title: Messaging: app self-closed with [Timers cannot be stopped from another thread]

labels.name: syncing_and_message_history
labels.description: issues related to improving message syncing

milestone.description:
General:
- Memory Usage Improvements (part 3)

General:
- Account Syncing

body:
### Description

1. i had my 0.8.1 installed and some data folder in place
2. i removed the app (not the data folder)
3. i downloaded RC 1 for 0.9.0 https://ci.infra.status.im/job/status-desktop/job/release/job/release%252F0.9.x/1/ for Mac
4. i started the app from application folder (default installation path)

As result, the app was closed with:

`status-desktop` output leading to crash.

**Status Version**: `0.9.0-rc-1`
**OS Version**: `macOS Ventura 13.0 (22A380)`
@stefandunca i logged this ticket (replying as a part of conversation in community)
I bet this is a duplicate of https://github.com/status-im/status-desktop/issues/8931, @0x-r4bbit ?

@caybro nope these are two different issues.
#8931 seems to panic due to insufficient write buffer inside the torrent library (haven't looked into this yet, and I'm honestly surprised to see this coming from the library)

This issue here panics due to close of an already closed channel.
Most likely related to the node trying to handle a new magnetlink while it's already processing a magnetlink (I thought I've ironed out all the edge cases but it seems like this is not the case)

Alright, so took me a while to reproduce this in an isolated program. But here is a fix to the problem: https://play.golang.com/p/Qm5CGVPAoNk

Will apply this to status-go now
Has been merged via updating status-go
